free_text.Content: 1. Introduction[br/]** Data representation[br/]** Supervised/unsupervised models (from regression and classification to probability distribution modelling)[br/]** Evaluation methodologies and performance measures (precision, recall, FA, FR, EER, HTER, MSE, ROC, AUC, DCF, DET, EPC)[br/]** Hypothesis testing and statistical significance[br/][br/]2. Classification and regression[br/]** Application examples (digit recognition, face detection)[br/]** Overview and connection with other EPFL courses[br/]** k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN)[br/]** Linear Regression (univariate and multivariate) and the Gradient descent[br/]** Logistic Linear Regression[br/]** Multi-Layered Perceptron (MLP) and the BackPropagation[br/][br/]3. Dimensionality reduction and clustering[br/]** Application examples (data analysis and texture recognition)[br/]** Overview and connection to other EPFL courses[br/]** k-Means[br/]** Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA)[br/]** Probabilistic Linear Discriminant Analysis (PLDA)[br/][br/]4. Probability distribution modelling[br/]** Application examples (speech recognition and biometrics)[br/]** Overview and connection to other EPFL courses[br/]** Histograms[br/]** Gaussian Mixture Models (GMM) and the Expectation-Maximisation (EM) algorithm[br/]** Hidden Markov Models (HMM)[br/]** Session Variability Modeling (Joint Factor Analysis) and Total Variability Modeling (iVectors)[br/]
free_text.Keywords: pattern recognition, linear models, PCA, LDA, MLP, BackProp, GMM, EM, HMM, JFA
free_text.Note: Labs with the open source software library BOB ( http://idiap.github.com/bob/ )
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Linear algebra, Probabilities and Statistics, Signal Processing
